metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16058 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in the pam_p11 component 0.2.0 and 0.3.0 for OpenSC. If a smart card creates a signature with a length longer than 256 bytes, this triggers a buffer overflow. This may be the case for RSA keys with 4096 bits depending on the signature scheme.

criterions.comment: pam-p11 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.1-1').
